title: The Leisure Hive
dialogue_triumphs: Brock tells the court that the Doctor's scarf strangled Stimson. The Doctor responds: 'Arrest the scarf then.'
goofs: The wires pulling K-9 along the beach are visible in episode one.
The Doctor and Romana are able to comment on Hardin's experiment, despite having missed the hologram of it.
In episode two the top of the sonic screwdriver is nearly bent off.
Presumably the Foamasi have to put on corsets before they don the skin-suits.

Why is everyone taken in by the phoney Brock's sudden acceptance of a seat on the board, and why is he (a West Lodge Foamasi) so interested in Hardin's experiments as a possible source of revenue when his interest is in the running-down of the Hive so that his group can buy it?

locations.name: Argolis
locations.current_status: First of the leisure planets, nearly destroyed by nuclear war

future_history: Argolis was nearly destroyed in a nuclear war with the Foamasi in 2250. The survivors built the Leisure Hive around 2270. A 20-year moratorium on a reduplication programme began around 2270. Romana mentions that this part of the galaxy doesn't discover 'unreal transfer' until 2386.
additional_notes: This episode marks a new direction for Doctor Who, moving away from traditional technobabble and featuring more stylish visuals.
bottom_line: A brave, if not altogether successful, experiment. The episode looks gorgeous thanks to stylish sets and imaginative visuals, but the overall execution is not entirely successful.
